TopicTitle: You might be a Kerbal if...?

Articles.Content:
It's been a while since I've seen this thread, so I figure why the hell not. It was a lot of fun last time around.

Your job is to simply fill in the blank--

You might be a Kerbal if... Dropping gears in your car reminds you of dropping stages in KSP.

Yay it's back!

If turning a full shopping trolley in a supermarket makes you think "Hmm, needs more reaction wheels"
You may be a Kerbal if, huh, that soda bottle needs some boosters to get orbit.

You maybe Kerbal if you dress up as one on Halloween...

Then promptly asked to work for NASA.
You may be a kerbal when you how much mods you need for your custom built plane to work.

You may be a Kerbal if you are green and live on a planet with (normally) no clouds....

ok, I know... lame.... let me have a do-over....

You may be a Kerbal if you always look at the Moon but secretly call it the Mun!
You may be a kerbal if you play HSP
You may be a kerbal if huh, that lego car needs more struts
You might be a kerbal if you look at the ships from Despicable Me and Minions in utter horror, not being able to visualize them flying without flipping even after seeing the movies.

1 hour ago, Matuchkin said:

You might be a kerbal if you look at the ships from Despicable Me and Minions in utter horror, not being able to visualize them flying without flipping even after seeing the movies.

And yellow???  What kind of color is yellow???   Green is so much more appropriate!!!

Also, you might be a Kerbal if you go outside at night, look up at the moon, and think to yourself, "Give me an hour..."
The bad part is I just caught myself doing this very thing....   

Edited February 12, 2016 by Just Jim

On 11/22/2015 at 9:42 AM, kiwi1960 said:

You may be a Kerbal if you are green and live on a planet with (normally) no clouds....

ok, I know... lame.... let me have a do-over....

You may be a Kerbal if you always look at the Moon but secretly call it the Mun!

i call the moon mun
You may be a Kerbal if you often tend to speak backwards.
